meanings.sent1: The bumpy bus ride made me feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The hard chair was making everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The squeaky door made an uneasy sound.
meanings.sent4: The uneasy silence in the room was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley looked very uneasy at night.

meanings.sent1: The old shoes were causing an uneasy feeling in my feet.
meanings.sent2: The tight dress made her movements uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The uneven ground made walking feel uneasy.
meanings.sent4: The uneasy relationship between the two countries was evident.
meanings.sent5: The uneasy chair creaked with every movement.

meanings.definition: Causing or feeling anxiety or unease
meanings.sent1: The dark forest path looked very uneasy to the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The upcoming exam was making the students feel uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The clown's strange antics made the children feel uneasy.
meanings.sent4: The uneasy feeling in the air hinted at an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The uneasy atmosphere at the meeting made everyone tense.
